title.label: One of the best survival games of all time

content.label: Don‚Äôt starve combines an extremely charming style with interesting and unique gameplay to create an experience very different from other survival games on the market. Though the game can be a bit repetitive at times, it is a great game that fans of the genre should definitely check out.

Buy the PC version on Steam and then use the SteamLink app to play.

title.label: Amazing game! Thank you so much

content.label:
This game is one of the best I‚Äôve ever played. It‚Äôs totally unique and I love all the characters, and the storyline is so creepy in a way that keeps you enthralled. 
Basically, you get dropped off in this world by this evil guy named maxwell. You have to survive, so get your own food by either finding it(vegetables and berries) or trapping it(small creatures, birds etc.) After you gather enough materials eventually you‚Äôll be able to set up a camp that‚Äôs well fortified and has all the necessities, like a science machine, alchemy engine, a few chests, a crockpot, etc.(hopefully). You never know what‚Äôs out there. At any moment you could accidentally run into a spider nest, get attacked by hounds, or startle a frog. And always the melancholy music plays in the background, reminding you that you are totally alone(at least in don‚Äôt starve, that‚Äôs why don‚Äôt starve together is easier on the nerves.) The jump scares, good or bad, make the game exciting and thrilling. I would highly recommend this to anyone who likes gritty survival games.
Eventually you find Maxwells door, which leads into Don‚Äôt Starve‚Äôs adventure mode. There‚Äôs no turning back after that. If you die in one of Maxwells worlds, or levels of survival, you are transported back to the door with no supplies, and have to restart. The adventure mode is extremely challenging and you have to have serious guts to face some of the monsters you‚Äôll find. But that sense of challenge and the levels of hunger, sanity, and health always in the balance are what make this game so enjoyable and iconic.
I‚Äôm really glad that this game included Reign of Giants. I wish it would have included Hamlet(another Don‚Äôt Starve mod I believe, although I haven‚Äôt played it) but other wise I love this game. Totally worth getting.
The characters are amazing! Wilson and Willow and Wes and Wendy and Webber are all such different characters that are lovely to play with. And Chester is so cute! Finding the eye bone for the first time made me so happy because Chester just ran up and started panting, and it was so cute! The whole game is so beautiful(in that creepy way) and the characters are all so unique and extraordinary. 

Anyway, thank you so much to the devs and Klei who made this game possible. Me and probably so many other players enjoy it so much and it make us so happy to see all the updates and add-one come out. I have spent so much time in my worlds, but it‚Äôs really worth it. Thank you for your continuous work on the games that makes all the adventure possible. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title.label: Can‚Äôt listen to other audio while playing

content.label:
I am such a Don‚Äôt Starve fiend! I love this game so much that I play on console while home and try to play the pocket version while out and about. The pocket version is surprisingly playable but the controls aren‚Äôt perfect. After much practice, I‚Äôm not scared of dying because I‚Äôm not clicking in the right places. 

But the main reason I give it 3 stars as opposed to 5 is that the app doesn‚Äôt allow you to listen to music while playing. Most apps will interrupt your music but you can resume the music once the app has launched. This app will not let you listen to anything. I always open the game excited to play, remember I can‚Äôt listen to music or podcasts, and then I close the game and do something else. I have read other people commenting about this so I hope it‚Äôs fixed in the future!
